document_data.name: Dag Zoreth
document_data.mainbody: '''Dag Zoreth''', born '''Brandon Caradoon''', was a [[cleric]] and [[strifeleader]] of [[Cyric]] at [[Darkhold]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite dragon/251/Rogues Gallery: Thornhold-The Harpers at Twilight|86,88}}
document_data.History:
Dag was captured by the [[Zhentarim]] when he was a young boy and raised into the ways of evil, despite the fact that he was the son of a [[paladin]]. Eventually, Dag Zoreth would mastermind the attack on his father's keep and murder him in a sacrifice to the Dark Sun.

At the head of a force of Zhentarim soldiers in the {{YearlinkName|1368}}, Dag Zoreth marched through the [[Clan Stoneshaft]] tunnels in the [[Sword Mountains]] to reach [[Thornhold]] on the [[Sword Coast North]]. On the way, they killed or enslaved many [[dwarves]], though Bronwyn Caradoon and [[Ebenezer Stoneshaft]] would later retake Thornhold. Thanks to the corrupt Sir Gareth of the [[Knights of Samular]], Dag Zoreth came close to possessing both ''[[Kezefbane]]'' and the ''[[rings of Samular]]'', only to be foiled by Bronwyn.
document_data.Relations:
He was the estranged brother of [[Bronwyn Caradoon]].

Dag Zoreth had a [[half-elven]] child with the [[elf]] [[Ashemmi]],

[[Malchior]], a fellow Darkhold cleric of Cyric based in [[Waterdeep]], had great influence over Dag's decisions there, thanks to a combination of blackmail, subtle deceit, and charisma. Dag and Malchior were the only ones aware of Sir [[Gareth Cormaeril]]'s corruption and conversion to Cyric.
document_data.Abilities: As a cleric, he commanded the [[Trickery domain]].
